definition: jackal and wolf/ravenous wolf/fig. evil person/vicious tyrant
jackals, wolves, tigers and panthers (idiom)/animals who are dangerous to man and cattle/fierce and cruel people
ravenous wolves hold the road (idiom); wicked people in power/a vicious tyranny rules the land
ravenous wolves block the road (idiom); wicked people in power/a vicious tyranny rules the land
ravenous wolves hold the road (idiom); wicked people in power/a vicious tyranny rules the land
ravenous wolves hold the road (idiom); wicked people in power/a vicious tyranny rules the land

sentences.english: I was the lion who drove the jackals from you while you slept.
sentences.chinese: 我就是在你睡熟时替你驱逐豺狼的那头狮子。

sentences.english: A golden jackal seen in the Mesopotamian marshes.
sentences.chinese: 这是一只生活在美索不达米亚沼泽中的金色豺狼。

sentences.english: We all know that she-wolf of a mother of yours wants me dead.
sentences.chinese: 我们都知道你那个豺狼一样的母亲希望我死掉。

sentences.english: Watch out for dangerous animals such as tigers and wolves while traveling in this forest.
sentences.chinese: 在森林中旅行时要当心像老虎豺狼之类的危险动物。

sentences.english: She is surrounded by jackals and other unholy creatures, the denizens of the cremation ground.
sentences.chinese: 她被豺狼和其他不神圣的人围绕着，那是火葬场的人。

sentences.english: He felt the creeping of fate, the circling of wolves, the hover of vultures.
sentences.chinese: 他感到命运的爬动，豺狼的包围，兀鹰的翱翔。

sentences.english: He strapped one of the Jackal shields to his forearm.
sentences.chinese: 他把其中一个豺狼人的护盾绑在自己的前臂上。

sentences.english: He is leaving Iraq to the wolves," he said.
sentences.chinese: 他正在把伊拉克丢给豺狼，”他说。

sentences.english: Jackals cry in chorus from the courtyard of the deserted house in the light of the worn-out moon.
sentences.chinese: 疲惫的月光中，豺狼在被废弃的院落中齐声嗥叫。

sentences.english: The flood did not arrive first embankment, wolf in the future first knife.
sentences.chinese: 洪水未到先筑堤，豺狼未来先磨刀。

sentences.english: What do you call a gnoll that won't share his forest?
sentences.chinese: 一个不肯和你分享森林的豺狼人叫做什么？

sentences.english: Their horses are swifter than leopards, fiercer than wolves at dusk.
sentences.chinese: 他的马比豹更快，比晚上的豺狼更猛。

definition: jackals, wolves, tigers and panthers (idiom)/animals who are dangerous to man and cattle/fierce and cruel people
variant of 兇惡|凶恶, fierce/ferocious/fiendish/frightening
man-eating (beast)/to eat people/fig. to oppress the people
